Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> This is a good time to be mining, if you believe in HUSH. Some CPU miners made some really good money yesterday! Many pools have not yet switched, so if you are an early adopter, you get a lot more block reward right now

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Many people are still mining the old legacy Hush chain, all their hashrate going the wrong place helps all the miners on the current mainnet

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Just some thoughts for the small-time miners, like myself

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Also, for people JUST maybe thinking about ASICs: Everybody is getting rid of their z9m's for almost NOTHING! And yes, they are old and not competitive against brand new asics. But for ~$200 you could be mining HUSH with an asic, and you also have the option to switch to KMD, ZEN, ZEC or various other coins. It's cheaper than a mid-range GPU to get into equihash asic mining. These machines were something like $2000 when they were new

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> https://www.ebay.com/sch/i.html?_from=R40&_nkw=z9+mini+batch+1&_sacat=0&LH_TitleDesc=0&rt=nc&LH_BIN=1

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I wouldn't pay more than $250ish for a z9m these days, but if you can get a real Bitmain PSU, those are worth about $100 new by itself

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> z9m is amazing device to learn on, super cheap

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ComputerGenie - ChickenPool> yes with psu is definitely worth more

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Some people are selling batch 1 z9m with PSU for really good prices, to get rid of them. It's a good buy for a beginner miner

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> you can also use an old desktop PSU you have laying around, if you want to save money. But Bitmain PSU will be more efficient, and use less electricity

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Z11 is compatible with HUSH, but good luck getting one

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I suggest used A9 or A9+ from ebay, if you have more funds

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ComputerGenie - ChickenPool> imo, for anyone looking ahead to expand, server PSUs with breakoutboard is the next best thing if you don't have an old PSU (far more options with them than a BM PSU)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> A9 is the better financial move, but will cost around $1500 last I checked. z9m is super cheap and will teach you about ASICs without breaking the bank

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ComputerGenie - ChickenPool> and for anyone looking to get in and stay in, the A9++ is key

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> if you have super cheap power, z9m is fine, but if not, the power efficiency of better miners is very important
